page.title: 13Ecology (3) in Leverton
page.content: The whole of the Wash area is a haven for all sorts of wildlife and our small patch is no exception.Many thousands of wading birds,geese and ducks spend the winter here and some stay to breed.The main species of waders are redshank,knot,dunlin and oystercatcher.Other species to be found include greenshank,godwits,ruff and various sandpipers.The predominant species of geese are dark-breasted brent and pink-footed.Shelduck are also found in large numbers with smaller numbers of mallard,teal and sea ducks.Occasional grebes and divers are also seen.Gulls and terns are also present in varying numbers at different times of the year.Plant life consists of salt tolerant grasses,sea purslane,samphire and some sea lavender.
